channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The finals have come early as the Eels attempt to right the ship against the Storm juggernaut. We'll have full live coverage from 7.30pm.
item.title: NRL 2020 LIVE: Parramatta Eels v Melbourne Storm at Bankwest Stadium

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Victoria recorded 216 new cases on Wednesday, its lowest daily case total in recent weeks, as mystery cases in NSW continue to concern health authorities.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Victoria records 240 new COVID-19 cases as state's hotel quarantine inquiry resumes; Australian death toll jumps to 463

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: A fast-tracked law and a defamation suit are among the wrangles involving the billionaire and WA's government. How did the trouble start? And why is a new law relating to Palmer so controversial?
item.title: What are the disputes involving Clive Palmer and the WA government about?

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Mid-career workers will be encouraged to make a leap into teaching under a new NSW Department of Education plan
item.title: New plan to lure mid-career workers into STEM teaching

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Nurses and guests gave scathing first-hand accounts of the hotel quarantine program at the inquiry.
item.title: Quarantine guests allowed to leave hotel three days after positive test

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: The NRL is on a collision course with top four clubs if it chooses to scrap a rule it only introduced last year.
item.title: Panthers, Eels could be forced to move home final as NRL considers rule change

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The senior detective investigating Arts Minister Don Harwin was told to fine him for a COVID-19 breach.
item.title: Police chiefs insisted Don Harwin be fined despite doubts

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: Construction boss George Alex said he is "totally innocent" and that all fraud charges against him are "a total stitch-up" as he walked free from Silverwater jail almost two weeks after he was granted bail in a Sydney court.
item.title: 'Total stitch-up': George Alex claims innocence as he walks out of jail

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Ten years since he was stolen from outside ANZ Stadium, and two decades on from The Dream, Roy and HG's unofficial mascot is going back where he belongs.
item.title: How Roy, HG and Fatso the Fat-Arsed Wombat stole the show in Sydney 2000

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Police raided the Australian Border Force's Kangaroo Point detention facility on Thursday and seized electronic devices.
item.title: Brisbane immigration detainee accused of possessing, distributing 'child exploitation material'

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Westfield shopping mall owner Scentre has begun locking non-rent-paying retailers out of their stores in a dramatic escalation of tensions between major landlords and their retail tenants.
item.title: Westfield locks retailers out of stores as rent battle escalates

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Melbourne's Dublin connection has grown stronger with the Demons signing a third Irishwoman to their AFLW list.
item.title: Stynes' legacy continues as Demons

item.dc:creator: Samantha Selinger-Morris
item.description: I, a lifelong dog lover, had a few prejudices before we got Licorice, as a 10-week-old kitten. My husband, meanwhile, who grew up with cats, is anti-dog.
item.title: When a cat comes between you, your husband and your neuroses

item.description: The cautious optimism comes despite figures again showing a steady rise in the overall number of confirmed cases and death toll on Wednesday.
item.title: Early signs coronavirus spread is slowing in Brazil

item.dc:creator: Scott Spits
item.description: Carlton have been bolstered for their suddenly cut-throat match against Gold Coast, bringing in Jack Martin and Marc Pittonet as AFL footy descends on the Top End.
item.title: Two changes for Blues as footy descends on Darwin

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The cultural review into Heritier Lumumba’s accusations of racism may not heal his relationship with Collingwood, but it will still prove transformative.
item.title: 'It doesn’t mean you don’t do the work': AFL sees upside in Collingwood's cultural review

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Social science and education academics have been asked to consider taking a day's leave without pay each week, as the university works out how to save money.
item.title: University of Sydney academics fear job cuts as COVID-19 woes deepen

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: Clive Palmer filed the documents in the Federal Court in Sydney on Wednesday, with a spokesman confirming they related to a claim that Mr McGowan had defamed Mr Palmer.
item.title: Clive Palmer launches defamation action against WA Premier

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: The flag will not be painted on AFL grounds for Indigenous round after the code failed to strike an agreement with a company that holds exclusive rights to its usage.
item.title: Federal government in talks to 'free' Indigenous flag

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: University student Tara Tolhurt has lived through flash floods, drought and bushfires. She is among 88 per cent of young people who don't feel schools have prepared them to protect themselves.
item.title: Young people want better disaster education after Black Summer fires

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: AMP’s continued insistence that one of its most senior executives, Boe Pahari, remain in his position is inexplicable.
item.title: 'Rainmaker' Boe Pahari should go if AMP is to regain trust

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Australia's stars could be rested this summer to spend time with their families while state players may be away in hubs for up to two months.
item.title: Family leave: Weary stars may be given time off, says Langer

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Victoria's ban on residential evictions has been extended until the end of the year, and the government will force commercial landlords to cut rent for small businesses hit by coronavirus.
item.title: More COVID-19 relief for renters, small business

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: As he prepares for his 200th game, Ben Stratton opens up on football, his playing future and riding a bike in a wetsuit.
item.title: 'Whatever happens, happens': Stratton's focus on team, not himself

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: Fremantle has bitten the bullet and will unveil talented 18-year-old Liam Henry on Saturday night in its Indigenous Round 13 clash with Sydney at Optus Stadium.
item.title: Dockers livewire Liam Henry to make debut in Indigenous Round clash

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: Evidence is emerging around the world showing some people who have never been exposed to COVID-19 have immune cells that can recognise and react to the virus.
item.title: Scientists discover many people unexposed to coronavirus have immune cells for COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: Former Crown Resorts boss Rowen Craigie has said he was not made aware by executives running the VIP operation that Crown's China employees were living in fear of arrest.
item.title: Crown board not told of escalating China risk says former CEO

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Panthers centre Stephen Crichton is close to inking a three-year extension with the club.
item.title: Crichton's parents put hard word on son to stay at Panthers

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Collingwood defender Darcy Moore is in no doubt he wants to stay a Magpie beyond this season and has not closed the door on his team winning the flag this season.
item.title: Magpies deal to come but length uncertain: Moore

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: But authorities say it's too soon to call an end to restrictions or even predict when they may be loosened.
item.title: Active cases drop by thousands as lockdown halfway point nears

item.dc:creator: Hanna Mills Turbet
item.description: The death of CDs and DVDs has been mooted for years – but the coronavirus pandemic may have just given the shiny disks a little extra time to spin.
item.title: 'The real thing': Forget streaming, CDs and vinyl stage COVID comeback

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Leon Cameron says Greater Western Sydney is ready to respond after last week's shocking loss to Sydney sent them tumbling out of the AFL's top eight.
item.title: 'Life and death footy': Giants' AFL finals hopes set to go on the line

item.description: Outspoken Russian opposition politician Alexei Navalny was unconscious and in intensive care after he started feeling unwell on a flight to Moscow.
item.title: Putin's opponent Navalny in hospital after suspected poison in tea

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Darryl Francis, 75, from the Fraser Coast suburb of Tinana, near Maryborough, died in Brisbane's Princess Alexandra Hospital.
item.title: First victim of Moreton Bay boat capsize near Green Island named

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Qantas chief executive Alan Joyce has flagged a gruelling year ahead for the airline and more job cuts as it confronts COVID-19 and a relaunched Virgin.
item.title: 'More tough decisions': Qantas to cut more jobs as COVID, Virgin threats loom

item.dc:creator: Tony Wright
item.description: Border communities are furious as South Australia imposes a ban on Victorians.
item.title: Uproar on the border as Victorians locked out of South Australia

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Pone Fa'amausili, one of Victoria's most promising young rugby stars, has re-committed to the Melbourne Rebels until the end of the 2022 season.
item.title: Rising local star Pone Fa'amausili re-signs with Melbourne Rebels

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: One of the NRL's best playmakers was going to be free to hit the open market on November 1, but the Roosters have stopped a rush for their five-eighth's signature.
item.title: Luke Keary signs bumper Roosters extension

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Port Adelaide pair Peter Ladhams and Dan Houston potentially jeopardised their side's premiership tilt by wilfully breaching the AFL's coronavirus protocols.
item.title: Houston, we have a problem: Port pair banned for 'wilful breach'

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has rejected a fresh round of calls for Queensland to open its borders, although some restrictions have been modified.
item.title: Premier 'won't bend' on border despite Qantas, federal government calls

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Sydney youngster Elijah Taylor has apologised to teammates for his costly quarantine blunder - and now has to walk the walk.
item.title: 'Now it's about actions': Swans say Taylor needs to earn back respect

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Australia's east coast is about to be hit by an "Antarctic blob" - a powerful weather system that will bring damaging winds to many regions and drop snow over elevated areas stretching from Tasmania to northern NSW.
item.title: 'Antarctic blob' to bring damaging winds, snow to eastern Australia

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Part of the Immanuel Gardens site in Buderim was locked down this week after four residents — since cleared of the virus — began displaying respiratory symptoms.
item.title: Queensland aged care residents 'volunteered' at centre checkpoint amid COVID-19 scare

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Yes, there was Trump bashing. But the Democrats finally got around to explaining their vision for America and making an affirmative case for Joe Biden.
item.title: On night three, Obama, policy take centre stage in the Democratic convention

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: The ABC says neither it nor the show's producers were aware of the term's racial connotations prior to broadcast.
item.title: 'Derogatory': Children's show Bluey tweaks episodes after complaint

item.dc:creator: Jacqueline Maley
item.description: Senior journalist Jacqueline Maley joins national science reporter Liam Mannix to unpack the government's decision to sign a letter of intent to make 25 million doses of coronavirus vaccine for Australia.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: should we pin our hopes on AstraZeneca vaccine?

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Rob Scott has warned of the damage of continued coronavirus restrictions on both the economy and Australians' mental health, saying the country must find new ways of living with the virus.
item.title: Wesfarmers boss warns of heavy COVID lockdown toll as profits slide

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: Victorians will on Thursday hear new information about the hotel quarantine program when those who worked inside the accommodation front the inquiry into the scheme.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Hotel quarantine bungles revealed at inquiry as Victoria records 240 new COVID-19 cases; Australian death toll jumps to 463

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Racing Victoria's international scout Paul Bloodworth is preparing for a series of late nights in front of the TV.
item.title: International features to shape Melbourne Cup nominations
